content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

In Julia, you can use the Markdown.jl package to parse the markdown document and extract the Julia code blocks. Here is a function that does this:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    ast = parse(Markdown.Parser, md)
    code_blocks = String[]
    function collect_code(node::Union{Markdown.CodeBlock, Markdown.FencedCodeBlock})
        push!(code_blocks, String(node.text) |> strip)
    end
    walk(ast, collect_code)
    join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function works by first parsing the markdown document into an abstract syntax tree (AST). It then defines a callback function `collect_code` that is called for each `CodeBlock` and `FencedCodeBlock` node in the AST. This function pushes the text of the code block, stripped of leading and trailing whitespace, onto an array. After the AST has been walked, the function returns the code blocks joined together with a double newline.
